name: Destegüllü Semazenler
description:
(Semazens with Destegül -bouquet of roses-)

Heres a little information behind this work; 

Sema is traditionally practised in a semahane (ritual hall) according to a precisely prescribed symbolic ritual with the semazens whirling in a circle around their shaikh.

The semazens enter wearing a black cloak (hırka) symbolizing death and the grave, which they remove before whirling.(Drawn in blue color) On their heads they wear a tall, brown hat known as a sikke, which symbolizes the tombstone and the death of the ego.(drawn in red on their head) 

Once their cloaks are removed, their long white robes (tennûre) and white jackets (destegül – meaning 'bouquet of roses') become visible. Both are symbols of resurrection. 

The Sema with the greatest significance to the Mevlevi order is the annual celebration of Mevlana's (or you may know him as “Rumi”) marriage to god (death), also called Seb-i Arus, meaning Nuptial Night or Night of Union. 

Approximately 750 years old, the Mevlevi Order is a living tradition (personally I doubt this part) based on the teachings of Rumi, also known as Mevlana, who is perhaps Turkey's most celebrated poet.
